Class Fighter

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JLabel
            • Unit
              • Fighter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.SwingConstants
    public class Fighter
extends Unit
    child of Unit, a fighter can move around the screen and attack. can queue up move commands, and is built from structure.
    Author:
    Mason Wickersham
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • movement

        public void movement()
        Uses moving boolean to tell whether it should move. Uses position of self and destination/target to find the angle to move on. Updates HP text label to follow it. If fighter gets within 27 pixels, either stops, or moves to next command in moveQueue. Also calls attack if it has a target.

      • angle

        public void angle()
        calculates angle for movement

      • attack

        public void attack​(Unit target)
        if target would die to damage, resets attack values and modifies target's HP. otherwise, just modifies target's HP.
        Parameters:
        target - targeted unit to damage.

      • setDestination

        public void setDestination​(java.awt.Point destination,
                           boolean shiftHeld)
        starts the movement loop, checks if shift is held. If it is, destination is added to queue. if shift isn't held, it resets the queue and moves to destination
        Overrides:
        setDestination in class Unit
        Parameters:
        destination - mouse coordinates
        shiftHeld - shift key held?

      • isMoving

        public boolean isMoving()
        Returns:
        is moving?

        Returns:
